item.title: RT by @NocturnePodcast: I had the opportunity to be interviewed by @NocturnePodcast about my blog Over 400 Women Shared What They Would Do At Night If They Weren‚Äôt Afraid. Admittedly, today was the first time I listened to the podcast and I cried. I just want women to be free. Even in the dark.

item.title:
The darkness is often talked about in negative terms, or simply dismissed as an afterthought. But darkness allows us the space to be quiet, turn inward, and touch the truth of our experience of being human. Listen to the new ep. "Light Enough".
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/light-enough/id951238847?i=1000563162237
item.dc:creator: @NocturnePodcast
item.description:
The darkness is often talked about in negative terms, or simply dismissed as an afterthought. But darkness allows us the space to be quiet, turn inward, and touch the truth of our experience of being human. Listen to the new ep. "Light Enough".

podcasts.apple.com/us/podcas‚Ä¶

item.title: RT by @NocturnePodcast: This episode of Nocturne talks about the language we use around night pollution, which like so many other Anthropogenic problems, obscures and silences the darkness. Darkness exists only in opposition to light, not as a valuable resource of its own.
item.dc:creator: @HollyTheAuk
item.description:
This episode of Nocturne talks about the language we use around night pollution, which like so many other Anthropogenic problems, obscures and silences the darkness. Darkness exists only in opposition to light, not as a valuable resource of its own.

nitter.42l.fr/NocturnePodcast/status/1528767716617691136#m

item.title: New episode! "Light Enough" - You won't find the word "Tenebrisology" in the dictionary - yet. It means, "the study of natural darkness", and it was created by lighting designer, Jane Slade. https://nocturnepodcast.org/light-enough/ or wherever you find podcasts.
item.dc:creator: @NocturnePodcast
